data.title: Grant Name, Meaning, Origin, History, And Popularity
data.meta_description: Grant is a name that adds a magnanimous and larger-than-life touch to your baby‚Äôs persona. Read on to explore more about this name.
data.text:
In This Article

Origin, Meaning, And History of Grant

Grant has English, French, and Scottish origins, and the name means ‚Äòtall,‚Äô ‚Äòlarge,‚Äô or ‚Äògreat.‚Äô It was initially an occupational title for someone large or tall. Grant is a surname with a long and fascinating history. It is thought to have originated in Scotland in the 12th century as a nickname for someone tall or of large build.

A grant may also mean ‚Äòto allow‚Äô or ‚Äòto grant permission.‚Äô The name was first used as a surname in the 12th century. The surname was preceded by ‚Äòle‚Äô or ‚Äòthe‚Äô in the 15th and 16th centuries.

It was either given to a person of exceptional size or used in a relative context to distinguish between people who shared the same personal name but often represented different generations of the same family.

Although it began as a surname, it grew in popularity as a nickname and given name. Grant is a popular surname and given name today.

Grant became more associated with demeanor than size over time. Grant represents strength, logic, and intelligence. Gant, Graft, Grand, Great, Granat, Grass, Gast, Grist, Grande, and Grandt are all similar surnames to Grant.

The common variations of the name Grant include Grand and Grandt (Germanic) and Grante and Grente (Old/Middle English). The popular nicknames for the name Grant include Gran, Granny, Granty, and Granto.

There are several notable fictional characters with the name Grant. Dr. Alan Grant is a character in the film Jurassic Park. Alby Grant is a character in the tv series Big Love. A soap opera named Brookside has characters named Barry Grant and Damon Grant. Cat Grant is a fictional character in the comic books published by DC Comics. Jo Grant is a character on the Sci-Fi TV series Doctor Who. Lou Grant is a character seen on the tv series The Mary Tyler Moore Show and its spin-off show named Lou Grant.

Notable People Named Grant

This section covers people who have made the name Grant famous with their contributions in various fields. It indeed is a little more inspiration for you to choose the name for your baby, don‚Äôt you think?

Hugh GrantEnglish actor and film producer

Cary GrantActor

Ulysses S. GrantMilitary General, Politician, 18th President of the United States

Grant GustinAmerican actor and singer

Lee GrantActress, documentarian and film director

Thomas Grant GustinAmerican singer and actor famous for his roles as Barry Allen (The Flash) on The CW series The Flash as part of the Arrowverse.

Grant RobisonAmerican runner who won the bronze medal in the men's 1,500 meters at the 2003 Pan American Games and participated in the 2004 Olympics

Edward Grant StockdaleAmerican businessman and diplomat who served as US Ambassador to Ireland from 1961 to 1962.

Grant SabatierAmerican author best known for his international bestselling book Financial Freedom.

Grant PotterAmerican cyclist who won the Gold medal at the 2010 Worlds Masters Stage Race, 2009 U.S. Masters National Champion, 2010 UCI Worlds top 5 finishers, 2010 Deutschlandsberg Worlds TT winner.

Grant "Twiggy" BakerA South African surfer who is a three-time world surfing champion, ocean conservationist, and entrepreneur

Grant Name‚Äôs Presence On Social Media

Before you finalize your baby‚Äôs name, you would want to assess if the name is rare or popular. Digital footprint of the name - it‚Äôs presence on the internet and social media platforms - can provide you with valuable insights on it‚Äôs popularity. A name‚Äôs online presence is an important metric for new parents to evaluate their options and make an informed choice. How many people are searching the name on Google, how many profiles are there on Facebook, does the name have a Wikipedia page? Such information surely tells you if the name is ubiquitous or unique. Grant‚Äôs Zodiac Sign As Per Western Astrology

Western astrology includes the construction of a horoscope based on the person‚Äôs exact time of birth and location to understand the positions of the planet, stars, and zodiac signs at that time. However, in popular culture, it is often narrowed down to the sun sign, which depends on the person‚Äôs birth date.There are 12 zodiac signs, each having dominant traits, planetary rulers, elemental connection, and more.

Zodiac sign or Sun sign

The Earth‚Äôs orbit around the sun is divided into 12 zodiac signs covering 30-degree sectors. According to Western astrology, the zodiac or sun sign depends on the sun‚Äôs position in one of these sectors at the time of your birth. Starting from the sun‚Äôs position at the March equinox, the chart goes anti-clockwise from Aries, followed by Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio, Sagittarius, Capricorn, Aquarius, and Pisces. These signs are ruled by planetary bodies - Mars, Venus, Mercury, Moon, Sun, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune. Furthermore, they are categorized into triplicities or elemental signs - fire, water, air, and earth - that govern their characteristics. Each of these zodiac signs features certain personality traits that may determine how a person presents themselves.

Each zodiac sign in Western astrology is linked to a specific range of dates in the year. Unlike Vedic astrology, where names can sometimes be used to infer astrological details, Western astrology relies entirely on the birth date.

To know more about your baby‚Äôs zodiac sign, choose the period in which your baby‚Äôs date of birth falls, from the options given below. This will give you a glimpse into the world of astrology tailored for your baby.

Grant‚Äôs Zodiac Sign And Birth Star As Per Vedic Astrology

Grant Personality Traits As Per Numerology

The numerology belief system envisages a relationship between a name and numbers. The related numbers are believed to give insights into a person‚Äôs character. We have researched this area to connect the numerology-based characteristic traits to the letters of the English alphabet. And the results are fascinating.

Numerology followers believe that each letter signifies attributes that can influence a person‚Äôs attitude and approach. Among these placements, the most significant are the first letter (Cornerstone) and the last letter (Capstone) of a name. Cornerstone highlights your primary personality traits and explains how you face challenges and opportunities in life. Capstone can tell you about your approach to work and how you complete them. Often, a letter may be repeated twice or more in a name. This repetition signifies the intensification or amplification of the traits associated with the letter in an individual‚Äôs personality.

Read to know what characteristics the name Grant is known for in numerology. Here we have avoided repetition of letters and added them just once for a better reading experience.

Infographic: Know The Name Grant‚Äòs Personality As Per Numerology
